name: Institutional Studies: English as a Discipline
base_name: Institutional Studies: English as a Discipline
long_desc: While literature has existed for centuries, the discipline of literary studies is relatively new, only forming in the late 19th century and not coalescing until after World War II. This course will look at the history of the discipline of literary studies, from its roots in scholarly methods like philology, to its expansion into cultural studies. Well read some key texts, such as Gerald Graffs Professing Literature, and critiques by Richard Ohman and many contemporary critics.

custom_fields.goals: To gain an understanding of the historical background of the discipline and profession that you are mastering
custom_fields.key_topics: The rise of English (as a discipline); academic labor; the rise of cultural studies; critical university studies
custom_fields.assessment_structure: One short paper and one medium-length final project
custom_fields.relevance: This course will examine this strange enterprise we inhabit
custom_fields.learning_resources: Canvas site with schedule and instructions for papers. It will also include some shorter readings, although books might also be required.
